question: Imagine you're setting up a new project in Google Cloud. What would be your first step? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Set up the VM infrastructure and network, then write scripts to automate it.
options.hint: Your approach is a quick start and automation.

options.text: Study the documentation and best practices to choose the optimal architecture.
options.hint: You like to analyze and find the best solutions.

options.text: Draw an architectural diagram of the project and present it to the team.
options.hint: You think visually and aim for a clear vision.

options.text: Define the project roadmap and goals to plan its development.
options.hint: You are focused on strategy and long-term planning.

options.text: Create checklists and access policies to ensure everything is organized.
options.hint: Order, organization, and compliance with standards are important to you.

options.text: Communicate with the team to understand their needs and expectations for the project.
options.hint: You prioritize collaboration and the needs of the team.

question: Imagine you're tasked with optimizing queries in BigQuery. What would be your first step? Choose the option that best fits your work style.

options.text: Immediately write scripts and tests for optimization to get a quick result.
options.hint: Your approach is hands-on action and rapid implementation.

options.text: Analyze the data and queries to find the most inefficient ones.
options.hint: You first delve into analysis to find the root of the problem.

options.text: Create visualizations to demonstrate the results of the optimization.
options.hint: You like to explain complex things using visual materials.

options.text: Train the team on how to use query optimization tools.
options.hint: You believe the best way to solve a problem is to empower others.

options.text: Prepare a presentation for management to show how optimization will impact efficiency.
options.hint: You are focused on strategy and communication with leadership.

options.text: Document the data structure and optimization processes to ensure everything is recorded for the future.
options.hint: You prefer order, documentation, and systematic approaches.

question: Imagine you're planning CI/CD for a new project. What would be your first step? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Set up pipelines and automation to speed up deployment.
options.hint: You focus on quick action and practical implementation.

options.text: Study CI/CD best practices to develop an effective process.
options.hint: You start with a deep analysis and a search for the best solution.

options.text: Develop a clear interface for monitoring the CI/CD process.
options.hint: It's important to you that the process is visual and understandable for everyone.

options.text: Coordinate the development team so everyone understands the new process.
options.hint: You prioritize communication and teamwork.

options.text: Create a release plan and quality control to ensure reliability.
options.hint: You are oriented towards strategy, planning, and control.

options.text: Document all CI/CD processes and instructions for future use.
options.hint: Your approach is to systematize and document every step.

question: Imagine you need to protect a cloud infrastructure from attacks. What would you do first? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Set up a firewall and monitoring to block threats.
options.hint: You're focused on quick, practical actions and protection.

options.text: Study threat and vulnerability reports to understand the potential risks.
options.hint: Your approach is deep analysis and strategy development.

options.text: Create visual threat diagrams to better analyze them.
options.hint: You like to visualize data for a better understanding of the situation.

options.text: Conduct security training for the team to increase their awareness.
options.hint: You believe that training and team interaction are key to security.

options.text: Develop a security policy to establish clear rules for the entire team.
options.hint: You are oriented towards leadership, strategic planning, and defining rules.

options.text: Document procedures and access policies to ensure compliance.
options.hint: Your approach is systematization, documentation, and control.

question: Imagine you're creating an ML model for data prediction. What is your approach? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Train the model on a dataset and write the code for its integration.
options.hint: You're focused on rapid implementation and hands-on work.

options.text: Analyze the data and choose an algorithm to get the most accurate result.
options.hint: Your approach is deep analysis and selecting the best solution.

options.text: Create visualizations of the results to show the model's effectiveness.
options.hint: You like to explain complex ideas using visual materials.

options.text: Collaborate with the team to obtain high-quality data.
options.hint: You believe the project's success depends on quality collaboration.

options.text: Present the results to management to justify the business value.
options.hint: You are oriented towards strategy, communication, and demonstrating value.

options.text: Document the model development steps so others can reproduce it.
options.hint: Your approach is order, systematization, and documentation.

question: Imagine you're creating a network infrastructure for a large project. What would you do first? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Set up routers and networks to ensure connectivity.
options.hint: You are focused on quick, practical actions and configuration.

options.text: Analyze traffic and bandwidth to optimize the network.
options.hint: Your approach is deep analysis and finding the most effective solutions.

options.text: Create a network map to visualize its topology for all participants.
options.hint: It's important to you that the process is visual and clear.

options.text: Coordinate the network team to avoid conflicts.
options.hint: You prioritize communication and effective teamwork.

options.text: Develop a deployment strategy to ensure efficiency.
options.hint: You are oriented towards strategy, planning, and leadership.

options.text: Document the topology and settings to ensure everything is recorded.
options.hint: Your approach is to systematize and document every step.

question: Imagine you need to set up a database for a new service. How would you approach this? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Immediately set up tables and indexes to make the database fast.
options.hint: You're focused on quick, practical actions and configuration.

options.text: Analyze queries and data structure to improve performance.
options.hint: Your approach is deep analysis and finding the most effective solutions.

options.text: Create a database schema as a diagram to make its structure clear.
options.hint: It's important to you that the process is visual and understandable for everyone.

options.text: Collaborate with the development team to understand their needs.
options.hint: You prioritize communication and effective teamwork.

options.text: Develop a backup policy to secure the data.
options.hint: You are oriented towards strategy, planning, and ensuring reliability.

options.text: Document the database structure and settings so others can work with it.
options.hint: Your approach is to systematize and document every step.

question: Imagine you're creating an analytical dashboard for management. What's your main focus? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Set up connections to data sources and automate updates.
options.hint: You're focused on quick, practical actions and automation.

options.text: Analyze metrics and KPIs to identify what's most important for the business.
options.hint: Your approach is deep analysis and identifying key indicators.

options.text: Design the dashboard to be intuitive and easy to understand.
options.hint: It's important to you that information is presented visually and clearly.

options.text: Discuss team and management needs to ensure the dashboard is useful.
options.hint: You prioritize communication and teamwork.

options.text: Present the findings to management to justify the conclusions.
options.hint: You are oriented towards strategy, communication, and demonstrating value.

options.text: Document the metrics and formulas for transparency and future use.
options.hint: Your approach is systematization and documentation of every step.

question: Imagine you need to integrate Google Workspace for your team. What would be your first step? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Set up access and groups to get everything working without delay.
options.hint: You're focused on quick, practical actions and configuration.

options.text: Study the documentation and best practices to set everything up correctly.

options.text: Create interactive diagrams for users to make it easier for them to understand.

options.text: Document settings and roles to avoid confusion.

question: Imagine you need to set up a scalable cloud architecture. What would you start with? Choose the option that best fits your style.

question: Imagine you're creating an analytical model for a business. What's your approach? Choose the option that best fits your style.

options.text: Immediately create scripts for data collection and processing to get started.
options.hint: You're focused on quick, practical actions and implementation.

options.text: Thoroughly analyze the data to understand patterns before building the model.

options.text: Present the results to management to justify business decisions.
